meanings.definition: The location or environment in which a film is set.
meanings.sent1: The filmsettings for the movie were a beautiful beach and a cozy cafe.
meanings.sent2: The director carefully chose the filmsettings to create the perfect atmosphere for the story.
meanings.sent3: The filmsettings for the horror film were so spooky that even the actors got scared.
meanings.sent4: Her dreamy filmsettings transported the audience to a magical world of fantasy.
meanings.sent5: The filmsettings of the bustling city brought life and energy to the film.

meanings.definition: The specific configuration or arrangement of settings on a camera or other filming equipment.
meanings.sent1: The photographer adjusted the filmsettings on the camera to capture the sunset perfectly.
meanings.sent2: Learning to control the filmsettings on a camera is essential for capturing great photos.
meanings.sent3: Oops! I accidentally changed the filmsettings on the camera and now everything looks blurry.
meanings.sent4: With the right filmsettings, even a simple scene can look incredibly cinematic.
meanings.sent5: His mastery of filmsettings allowed him to create stunning visual effects in his films.
